name: ExecuteSql
description: Execute a SQL query on an Azure SQL Database
author: Geek Learning

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure RM Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to target for executing SQL

inputs.name: ScriptType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of the script: File Path, Inline Script or Predefined Script.

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script to execute. Should be fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory.

inputs.name: PredefinedScript
inputs.label: Predefined Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Predefined script to execute. You can see the required variables for each predefined script on the [wiki](https://github.com/geeklearningio/gl-vsts-tasks-azure/wiki/Azure-SQL-Execute-Query).

inputs.name: Variables
inputs.label: Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Variables passed to the SQLCMD script with the -v option. Should be formatted like 'Var1=Value1', with one variable per line. It can then be used with the SQLCMD $(Var1) syntax in the script.

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Azure SQL Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure SQL Server name like, FabrikamSQL.database.windows.net,1433 or FabrikamSQL.database.windows.net.

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Azure SQL Database.

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: Server Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Azure SQL Server administrator login.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for the Azure SQL Server administrator.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release Definitions as '$(passwordVariable').
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: QueryTimeout
inputs.label: Query Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of seconds before the query will time out. Default is 60 seconds.

inputs.name: IpDetectionMethod
inputs.label: Specify Firewall Rules Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: For the task to run, the IP Address of the automation agent has to be added to the 'Allowed IP Addresses' in the Azure SQL Server's Firewall. Provide the IP Address range of the automation agents, or select to auto-detect in case of hosted automation agent.

inputs.name: StartIpAddress
inputs.label: Start IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The starting IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.50.

inputs.name: EndIpAddress
inputs.label: End IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ending IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.65.

inputs.name: DeleteFirewallRule
inputs.label: Delete Rule After Task Ends
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, then after the task ends, the IP Addresses specified here are deleted from the 'Allowed IP Addresses' list of the Azure SQL Server's Firewall.

inputs.name: AzureEnvironment
inputs.label: Azure Cloud Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Cloud Environment name i.e AzureCloud, AzureChinaCloud etc.
